items.title: Engineering Manager / Director
items.content:
Is writing the first line of code on a brand new product something that scares you? What about hiring an engineering team? Setting up the tools, infrastructure, defining the architecture in the first few weeks in the job too much for you? If the early years give you energy, continue reading.

We are a small team of experienced entrepreneurs, with a significant investment from a premier investor, taking on one of the biggest challenges of the 21st century: The healthcare industry. The part of the industry that touches people lives directly using modern technology, that helps them get care when needed and gives them peace of mind during some of the least fun moments in life. We can't say too much about it, but we have a few buzz words to throw out there: Mobile, AI, digital, universal access, easy to use, beautiful, modern, integration, global, behavioural science.

You are a top engineer, architecture connoisseur, lead-by-example kind of person. You've been there and done that. You know the hundreds (thousands?) of gotchas for building an infrastructure to support Mobile, Web, Email, SMS experiences and more. You can balance engineering excellence with the business and product needs. And, you do it fast, really fast.

This opportunity is not for the faint-hearted. A lot of responsibilities will rest on your shoulders, and the expectations are high. You'll be the first engineer in the team and the first leader. Your beliefs and philosophies will define the engineering team beliefs and philosophies. You'll help us craft the product, the processes, the tools, and, most important of all, the team. We are just starting out, and we have great clarity in our vision and mission; now we need to figure out the how and what.

What we expect from you:

- You have a formal education in Computer Science, Computer Engineer, or equivalent (in place of that, you acquired those skills after many years of on-the-job training, working with other extraordinary software engineers).
- You are a master at software architecture, componentisation, microservices, infrastructure, etc.
- You are pragmatic and don't overdo on abstraction, testing, and processes, but you understand the value and trade-offs.
- You are comfortable with all the duties of DevOps, from continuous integration to cloud management, sprinkled with some DBA skills. In the early days, we'll have to share these responsibilities with other people on the team until we hire for that role.
- You are very comfortable defining APIs, building backend services, using relational databases (and document-based / NoSQL DB), messaging queues, cloud services (AWS or Azure), etc.
- You are good (or great) at HTML, CSS, JS, and some of the modern web frameworks (React, Bootstrap, Angular, SASS / LESS, etc.)
- You've worked with mobile developers, lead a team of mobile developers, or built mobile applications yourself.
- You've managed developers and know many exceptional developers here in London (we'll need to hire them as well).
- Oh, and you are great with people! You'll be a manager. You'll also participate in strategic decisions, board meetings, and even customer visits every once in a while.
- What about the technology stack? You get to pick it from one of the moderns one: NodeJS, .NET, Python, etc. (Sorry, but no-go for RoR or PHP)

What you'll get from us:

- Work with talented individuals, where you can learn from and teach each other.
- Accelerate your career by ten years in just three!
- Great freedom to be the best that you can be (and become better): flexible hours, access to whatever devices & software you need.
- Work on a meaningful product to help people, doctors, nurses, and more.
- Work in the heart of London in a very cool office space.
- A top of the market salary and compensation package.
- We are firm believers in the value of diversity and equality at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age or marital status.

This position is based in London, and we work at a fantastic co-working space in Oxford Circus. We are not interested in remote workers, contractors, or working with recruiters. Your compensation will be above market (we saved the money we'd pay a recruiter and bump up your salary), and you'll get many other real benefits.

We are biased by competency, action, kindness, collaboration, speed, and modern approaches and look forward hearing from you.

We are a highly dynamic startup willing to disrupt the food and drinks wholesale industry, using technology to make good food accessible.

The ideal candidate has a strong background in either food, drinks, hospitality and wholesale and is terrific in sales and customer acquisition. Preferably the candidate has also a good network in the industry (such as restaurants, hotels, corporate), including London-based. The candidate needs to have a very good understanding of the food supply chain, the wholesale industry and the needs of both sides of the transaction (food producers / buyers).

The head of sales and account management would lead a team of more junior people and will be responsible of defining and deploying fast an acquisition and growth strategy.

We are about to finalise a new funding round led by a great VC, which means there is great opportunities for growth within our company. The candidate would become part of the management team, working in tandem with our CEO. The position includes a good fixed salary, bonuses depending on targets, and equity shares as incentive.

The job is London-based (west London) and we are of course flexible with hours or the need for remote working when necessary.

If you think you are the right one and all this sounds exciting, please send us an email!

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

items.title: Account Executive - Western Europe
items.content:
*The Basics:*

As a Branch Evangelist in Western Europe, you will work cross-functionally with Product, Marketing, and Partner Growth to bring our Premium Solutions to market. You will work with our largest existing customers to help them leverage our newest products and features. You’ll also reach out to new potential partners and drive them to integrate Branch’s deep linking solutions. You will succeed in this role if you are an energetic and organized self-starter who understands the sales process, can build relationships with the right decision-makers, and can succinctly define and communicate the specific benefits of Branch appropriate for each customer. You will be a key driver of revenue growth for the company, and on the front lines for evangelising our product to prospective and existing users as well as strategic channel partners.

*What You’ll Do:*

* Establish our growing monetisation channels and deliver revenue for the company.
* Work cross functionally with Marketing and Product, delivering real-time feedback on our new and existing products and features.
* Work autonomously and remotely, developing the market in Western Europe, traveling as needed (up to 50%).
* Demonstrate how mobile app developers can utilise Branch in a variety of ways, through phone calls, demonstrations, and presentations.
* Identify tactics to build local groundswell and brand awareness to support the sales cycle.
* Design and execute sales campaigns.
* Build and manage a sales pipeline.
* Make every potential Branch user happy with every interaction, regardless of deal size.
* Build and enhance relationships with our largest partners.
* Create and localise sales materials and demos to effectively showcase Branch.
* Represent Branch at relevant regional conferences and events.

*We’re Looking for Someone With:*

* 3-4 years of experience in a Sales or customer-facing role at a mobile technology company, with a track record of top performance.
* Ability to understand the Branch SDK in-depth and communicate its benefits to both technical and non-technical customers.
* Strong interest in mobile technology and mobile SDKs.
* Full written and speaking fluency in English, strong preference for additional fluency in French, Spanish, and/or German.
* A strong work ethic and internal drive to produce results.
* Data-driven, and experience managing a pipeline using Salesforce or similar SFA tool.
* Humility, and a partner-first mentality.

*Nice to Haves:*

* Prior experience at a growth stage Internet/Software company, selling enterprise solutions.
* A thorough understanding of Email Marketing and Email Service Providers (ESPs).
* Mobile development experience.

*About Us:*

Branch (branch.io) is the deep linking and mobile growth standard that helps mobile marketers and developers attribute app installs, optimize and create invite systems, and do smarter in-app sharing through our unique device fingerprinting and deep linking technology. Marketers and developers use Branch to seamlessly integrate their apps into all marketing communications and channels. We dynamically generate short URLs on the fly that pass and track data from the originating source through installs, across devices, and across platform. We use this technology to provide brands a deeper insight into app installs, more personal customer acquisition, and better engagement of users with our variety of SDK features.

We have amazing investors (raised over 50 million in funding) and a team based in Palo Alto of over 90 employees from different backgrounds, experiences, and educations, all passionate about the work we do, the team we do it with, and the partners we do it for. We are constantly releasing new products and solving fascinating problems.

If you are the type of person that loves working hard in order to solve challenging problems, appreciates a culture of transparency and ownership, and thrives with no micromanagement, then this could be a great place for you.

items.title: Account Manager
items.content:
WhiteHat is a tech startup founded to address the lack of high-quality, career-focused apprenticeships on offer for ambitious young people and provide employers with the means to attract the best non-graduate talent.

Our mission is to accelerate incredible careers and develop a diverse group of future leaders.

We are looking for an exceptional account manager to support our existing clients and drive deep and enduring partnerships with employers, encouraging them to increase the range and number of apprenticeships they offer across their business.

*The Role*

* Ongoing management of client relationship
* Keep CRM system updated with client touchpoints and ensure regular management of both current and previous clients is maintained at all times
* In-work support of employer to get ongoing feedback of apprentices in seat.
* Work with the Coaches and IQA to highlight at risk candidates as early as possible and work with the employer to find a solution to any issues.
* Land and expand within an existing account
* Upselling existing clients into new types of apprenticeships, encouring the progression of existing apprentices to additional apprenticeship levels, and upselling volume of hires
* Take a consultative approach to selling at all times
* Drive processes forward on the employer side by educating clients on the importance of giving candidates prompt feedback and clarity on decision making timelines
* Encourage clients to submit feedback on candidates in a timely manner to support candidate coaching
* Encourage clients to move existing apprentices to WhiteHat where they are currently contracted to another training provider
* Collecting employer availability for interviews and coordinating with our talent managers to get candidates booked in for interviews
* Constantly be looking for ways to improve hiring conversions and the efficiency of our process
* Act as a representative of the WhiteHat values and brand at all times, acting with integrity in everything you do

*About You*

* You are passionate about helping to deliver the best learning opportunities to young people
* You care deeply about how both our customers and our users perceive us
* You have a proven track record in achieving outcomes and demonstrating success
* You have previous experience in an account management role with upsell / land and expand mandate and goals
* You have a consultative sales style
* You ideally have startup experience

*Our Values*

* We are all owners: we think about the impact of our actions on the team, the company and on our external perception
* Good people win: we believe that respect flows both ways; we are approachable, warm and responsive
* We put others first: we go above and beyond to create an exceptional service and experience for our users
* We believe in social mobility: your background should never define your destination
* We are changemakers: we are working to create impact at scale
* Integrity is paramount: we put our apprentices’ success first
* We are honest but kind: direct feedback delivered with kindness helps others realise their full potential
* We are mission & results driven: we pursue excellence in everything we do and we energise and inspire others through the standards we set

items.title: Operations and Accounts Manager
items.content:
The Company

Yourfittingroom is an online fashion marketplace and delivery company that aims to change the way people shop for fashion online. We allow customers the opportunity to experience the quality and fit of items for 30 minutes at home before making a purchasing decision. Eradicating missed deliveries, purchasing ill fitting clothes and arranging returns, Yourfittingroom breathes a breath of fresh air into the tired online shopping and delivery experience. 

On the other side of the marketplace, our unique delivery method gives independent brands a better way to introduce themselves to new customers. We remove the risk from purchasing a high price piece from an unknown brand by encouraging customers to experience items for themselves before asking them to commit to the purchase. We help customers discover new brands and brands reach new customers. 

_The Role_

As one of the first employees, the role isn’t set in stone. The founder is seeking a person who will help shape the business and potentially evolve into the COO role over time. Currently the role covers the following:

-Manage brands: You’ll be required to build and manage relationships with the 10 brands we currently work with. We’re a service driven business so understanding the problems our partners face and fixing them is critical to our success. 

-Understand customers: The entire team will spend time on the road making deliveries. This is our bread and butter. We’re still at a stage where we’re trying to find product/market fit so delivering gives us the perfect opportunity to build feedback into our process. 

-Solve Problems: Every day is different in the dynamic world of startups. We’re looking for someone who views problems as challenges waiting to be overcome. A self starter who’ll take responsibility for ensuring things are running smoothly without being asked. 

_The Person_

We welcome applications from people from all backrounds, skills and experiences but ideally, you’ll have some of the below: 

-People person: This role requires constant communication with our B2B and B2C customers so great people skills is a must. 

-Project delivery experience: We’re looking for an organiser. A project manager type that enjoy getting things done. 

-Passion for the industry: We’re not your run of the mill delivery company. We’re a fashion company that delivers. 

-Hard worker: We’re an early stage start up so we need somebody who works well under pressure and is willing to put in the extra hours. 

_Our Offering_

Between £1800 and £2200 per month and an equity share

items.title: Account Manager
items.content:
Account Manager – UK, London!

We started iZettle with a single mission: to empower small-business owners to sell smarter by offering them the tools typically reserved for bigger players. We have come a long way, but there is so much exciting work ahead of us. Therefore, we need the best and brightest people to help us get it done. Our fast-growing start-up was founded in 2010 and currently has approximately 450 employees across its offices in London, Berlin, Madrid, Mexico City, Sao Paulo, Edinburgh and Stockholm (HQ).

We are looking for a sales-driven, competitive and hard-working Account manager for the UK market, starting as soon as possible. As an Account manager you will deliver an excellent customer experience to our most loyal
customers together with a focus to drive account retention. At iZettle you’ll play an essential part in building relationships with our biggest customers. This is a full-time position, based UK, working for the UK market. Your team will consist of Account managers from Sweden, UK and Norway and you will report directly to the team
leader in Stockholm.

As an experienced account manager, you’ll have no problem nurturing a significant number of relationships with few natural touch points. Your systematic approach will mean a seamless service for our clients and a steady flow of repeat business for us. For this position you will have a big impact on the continuous growth of our new retention team. With the right drive and attitude there will be endless opportunities for you to grow together with iZettle.

Who we think you are:

• You are professional, organized and motivated as well as have the drive to succeed in a fast-paced environment
• A team player personality and you strive to contribute to iZettle’s positive working atmosphere
• Genuine passion for sales & service and a “Get it done” mentality
• Excellent negotiating and people skills
• You love new challenges and are passionate about providing the best customer experience
• You can sell, of course, and your customers love to work with you!

Requirements
• 2-4 years experience in sales/account management/business development
• Business related education and B2B experience
• You are fluent in English
• Excellent communication skills
Simply put, our team is looking for someone awesome! You have the skills to win great deals, but you don’t climb over people to do it. You are motivated, competitive, persuasive, hard working, but humble. You want your team to win, and you play the right way!

If you are interested in this position, please send your CV and cover letter in English.
We are looking forward hearing from you!
